fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page with title that contains a hyphen. Example : hello-world
# Create a few anchors by inserting the Table of Content macro into the page.
# Copy the anchor URL and paste it on another Confluence page.
# Click onto the pasted link and you'll be directed to a broken anchor on the page.

h3. Cause
The anchor is broken because the word after the hyphen on the page name is duplicated twice in URL.

Example for hello-world page. The word world is duplicated.

http://localhost:8090/display/S/hello-world#hello-world-world-what

h3. Workaround
# Do not use hyphen in the page title
# Remove the duplicated word after the "#" in the URL and the anchor link should work fine (Tested on Confluence 6.3.3)
fields.summary: Page title with hyphen (-) breaks anchor link when pasted onto Confluence Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the 'Attachments' macro to list all attachments from another page will not upload additional attachments to the page using the drag and drop option. However, using the "Browse for files" option works as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Confluence
# Create a new space
# Create a new page in that space
# Insert the 'Attachments' macro to the page
# Edit the macro and modify the 'Page Title' field to another page (preferably one that contains attachments)
# Save the macro settings and save the page
# Drag and drop an attachment to the macro

h3. Expected Results
The attachment will be added to the page specified in the 'Page Title' field earlier and it will be appended to the list of attachments in the macro.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is added to the current page where the macro exists instead. You can view the attachment by navigating to "{{...}} >> Attachments".

h3. Environment
Experienced this issue in the following environments:
# Windows 10 - Google Chrome Version 50.0.2661.75 (64-bit)
# Ubuntu 14.04 LTS - Google Chrome Version 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit)

h3. Workaround
# Add attachments using the "Browse for files" option in the 'Attachments' macro.
# Add attachments directly by navigating to the page.
fields.summary: 'Attachments' macro does not upload attachments using drag and drop

fields.description:
*Steps to Replicate*
# *Edit* and Confluence Existing page and *Save* it.
# Navigate to Confluence Dashboard > *All Updates*

*Expected behaviour*
The page recently edited timeline will be display in *All Updates* immediatedly as (Updated a minute ago)

*Actual Behaviour*
The page is not displayed in the *All Updates* immediately. After an hour, the page appear in *All Updates* but the recently edited timeline shows (Updated a minute ago) while we can see (last modified about an hours ago) from the page. 
PS: This issue appears intermittently.

*Possible cause*
Internet Explorer caching the JSON data which seems to be a pretty [well-known issue|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6115342/json-is-being-cached-incorrectly] with developers in IE.

*Workaround*
- Access Confluence by using Chrome and Firefox
- Or, in Internet Explorer
## Go to Cog Menu > Internet Options
## General Tab, Click Settings
## Select "Every time I visit the page" (it will always include "Cache-control: no-cache")
## Click OK
## Click OK
fields.summary: Confluence "All Updates" does not show recently updated pages timeline correctly in Internet Explorer 10/11.

h3. Summary
When a Confluence page is linked from a JIRA issue , the link is created from JIRA side but the link is not reflected on Confluence page top JIRA links

This behaviour can change , and it might work for the first time but will not work next time . And the total links are not shown correctly

h3. Environment
Jira used: 6.1.6
confluence used: 5.9.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Link a page from multiple JIRA issues
# Check the JIRA links from the page mentioned in the JIRA issue

h3. Expected Results
The JIRA issue links should appear with a correct count on the page.

h3. Actual Results

The links are not displayed correctly, eg: if 3 issues are linked to the page then the link will show only 1 link
 
h3. Notes
When we Flush all cache from *General Configuration >> Cache Management >> Flush All* , then the issue links are shown correctly but when a new link is added the issue re-occurs.

h3.Workaround
If we click on the JIRA links on the page it shows all the linked issues
fields.summary: JIRA links not updated on page when page is linked from a JIRA issue

When you access a Space, the sidebar is blank and Space Tools is missing.

{code}
2017-02-01 11:31:42,989 ERROR [ajp-nio-8009-exec-121] [plugin.descriptor.web.ConfluenceWebInterfaceManager] getHtml Failed to render web panel: com.atlassian.plugin.web.descriptors.DefaultWebPanelModuleDescriptor$ContextAwareWebPanel@40857e64
 -- url: /display/KEY/Page | page: 4260294 | traceId: 5589811101dedf7a | userName: username | referer: https://confluence.company.com/spacedirectory/view.action | action: viewpage
java.lang.RuntimeException: Entities can only be used with a single EntityManager instance

# Verify if there is a Duplicate Entry in "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK"

{code}delete from "AO_187CCC_SIDEBAR_LINK" where "ID" = {ID of the duplicate entry};{code}

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41414].
  {panel}

At the moment, Confluence doesn't have any way to allow administrators to disable mail servers (they can only add/remove them) in the Confluence UI. Instead, a system property needs to be set at the JVM level to disable the mail server. 

Adding this to the Confluence UI would allow Administrators to disable email servers as needed, for example if they wanted to bulk edit pages or spaces.

h6. Workaround:
# Stop Confluence
# Add {{-Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=true}} to the JVM arguments for Confluence as described in [Confluence System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html]
# Start Confluence

(i) This will only disable automated emails from being sent, it will not prevent test emails from being sent manually
fields.summary: Allow Confluence adminstrators to disable mail servers temporarily

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41399].
  {panel}

Currently, the JIRA Issue Macro seems to contain a limitation - that, unless a user is in the "jira-users" group on JIRA, it is impossible for them to view JIRA issues presented by the JIM plugin, even though the JIRA project in question is open for anonymous browse access.

However, it appears that this is supported in the underlying metadata by adding the "<ac:parameter ac:name="anonymous">true</ac:parameter>" (using the Confluence Metadata Editor).

The only problem with this is that it gets wiped out if you ever perform an Edit/Save on the inserted JIM. Currently, the only solution we've found for this is to reapply the metadata edit.

I believe this could be resolved in a couple of ways

# the JIM editor sucks in the existing metadata, updates only what's changed and writes it all back out - thus persisting any underlying metadata edits or
# (my preferred solution) - the JIM plugin is updated to expose the anonymous setting as an "Allow anonymous access" checkbox. The default would be as "unchecked" to replicate current behaviour but ticking the checkbox would cause the insertion of the "anonymous=true" parameter in the underlying metadata. If that setting already exists in the metadata then, when the JIM is edited in the future, it's current value is exposed in the setting of the checkbox.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro should support Anonymous JIRA users

  {panel}

This comes from a post on [Answers.Atlassian.com|https://answers.atlassian.com/] which I believe would be a valid feature.

[Is there a way to disable notifications in a space?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/143231/is-there-a-way-to-disable-notifications-in-a-space?page=1#143633]

The use case would be that a company has multiple spaces but has a specific space which contains sensitive information that they would not like to have traveling over the internet via email.  However, they would still like to be able to have this ability available for spaces which do not contain sensitive information.  So the idea would be say an option in the space admin screens (say a check box) that when checked stops all emails related to that space from being created.

*workaround in the meantime*
Add a filter at the mail server level which blocks emails which contain links to the space in question.  For example 'http://localhost:8090/display/TEST' so they are still created by Confluence but never actually get sent.
fields.summary: Block emails/notifications from a specific space

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41376].
  {panel}

In JIRA we have a single select custom field called 'Severity'.  This field is a required field, so will pop-up in the JIRA-Macro when the issue is created from Confluence. We do not have a default value for this field selected: !image-2016-04-13-09-20-48-559.png|thumbnail! 

The behavior in JIRA is that on the create screen this value has by default no value, showing "None". The user has to choose a value. This is exactly the behavior we prefer; forcing the user to think about the value this field should have on creating an issue: 
 !image-2016-04-13-09-21-48-861.png|thumbnail! 

When a user creates an issue from our linked Confluence instance, the field is shown on the create screen, but already has a value assigned. So the user is not forced to select a value in this case: 
 !image-2016-04-13-09-23-44-462.png|thumbnail! 

We would expect to have the same behavior here.
fields.summary: JIRA issue marcro behaves different from JIRA on a custom field without default value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41375].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have to store Confluence content in a database so it can be found in an external search web application. I can get the last modified date of e.g. a page via Confluence REST API and cql (e.g. /rest/api/content/search?cql=space=ds and lastModified > lastStoredTimeStamp and type = page). 

We want the process of storing confluence content be incremental (e.g. update only modified pages in the database). The problem is that a permission change doesn't update the last modified timestamp (e.g. history.lastUpdated field of the REST API answer). Is there a way to know permission changes via any Confluence API?

I need to answer the following questions:
Is there a way to know when a Confluence document is updated? Yes, via REST API
Is there a way to know when a Confluence document permission is updated? 
Is there a way to know when a Confluence user account changes e.g. joins/leaves a group?

Permission Changes (History) should be available via API.
fields.summary: A way to know permission changes via API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting a page that has an apostrophe {{’}} in its title, the XML result will change it to a single quote {{'}} instead.
If you have a another page {{PageA}} linked to the page with apostrophe title for example {{Test ABC’s}}, the internal link escapes the apostrophe properly in the URL but the page name has already changed to {{Test ABC's}} after the import. So the link will fail.

h3. Environment
Reproduced on 5.6.3, 5.9.6, 5.9.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page with this name {{Test ABC’s}}
# Create another page {{PageA}} and insert a link to the page {{Test ABC’s}}
# Save and export those pages by XML backup
# Import the XML


h3. Expected Results
Both pages should be imported successfully with the proper names and the internal link should be working.

h3. Actual Results
{{PageA}} is imported properly, but the other page title becomes {{Test ABC's}} instead of {{Test ABC’s}}. Internal link is broken as well because the page name has changed.
 

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to update the page title from the database manually
{code:language=sql}
UPDATE CONTENT
SET TITLE = REPLACE(TITLE, 'ABC''s', 'ABC’s')
WHERE SPACEID = <space_id> AND TITLE = 'Test ABC''s'
{code}
fields.summary: Page title with apostrophe replaced with single quote at export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41353].
{panel}
It is very likely that after sharing a page with someone, that page name will be changed. The hyperlink in the "share email" will then be out of date and when the user clicks to go view the page, the Page Not Found error they see isn't a very good user experience.

Seems reasonable to embed the tiny link in the email's hyperlink instead and completely remove this potential bad experience.
h4. Issue Description

As the link generated in the email is a static page URL, if there is changes in the page title after the email notification is sent, the page won't be accessible by the link directly anymore.
h4. Expected Result

User get redirect to the correct page
h4. Actual Result

User received a "Page Not Found" message as the title of the page is no longer the same.
h4. Suggested Resolution

Using a *tiny URL* or *pageid* will be a better approach.
fields.summary: URL sent when sharing a page should use tiny link or PageID

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41350].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian

We keep on seeing use cases where people has structures like this, anywhere in the page hierarchy

{code}
ProjectX
    Documentation
       Motivation
       Requirements
    Deliverables
    Meetings
        August 1st
        July 1st
        KickOff 
{code}

And while this makes a lot of sense to them, it totally makes the pages absolutely "un-findable" by the search. A search like "ProjectX Meetings" would basically give nothing, and a search by "Meetings" just hundreds of results from as many spaces. ProjectX could also be the title of the space, but in this case the same effect will happen, only that at least users will see the title in the search results, even if the right one comes in the third page.

Of course we are telling people to write longer titles that include redundant information, but how far can one go? To find "ProjectX Requirements" one would like to include three hierarchical levels in the title! I find it a bit too much to ask to users

What I would like is for Confluence to include the page hierarchy as a field in the index, with a higher priority than the body content but perhaps less than the page title. It could a single field that itemises the ancentors up to the Space Title or just one field each for parent, grandparent and space title, in this case perhaps weighted differently.

But believe me, our users are not particularly happy and these cases are extremely common.
Thanks a lot for considering this.
Daniel
fields.summary: Confluence search should also use the space title and the parent page title in addition to the title of the page

Hi, 

Currently i've discovered how work the past due billing system of Confluence and it I have some ideas to improve it.

1 - When a payment bounce only 1 email reminder is sent to the financial contact. This could be increased, as an email can be easily missed from the finance user. 

2 - As an admin of our Atlassian instance, not member of finance, I was never made aware of any payment issue, and discovered it only when the instance was shut down. Admin (even users?) should be warned of this, as it impact all processes in the company when instance is shut down. 

3 - To resolve the payment issue, it seems that we need to connect with the account that is the financial contact in JIRA/Confluence. The issue is that the financial contact, in our case, is NOT an account in our instance - just a mailing list, so we can't connect to solve the payment issue. we are lock out the instance. It should be mandatory to select a user.
fields.summary: Billing Improvement for cloud version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41348].
  {panel}

When a user requests access to a page an email is sent to the page creator. This contains a link to the Page and a link 'Grant Access' 
Some users will click on the page link (to see the page) and then add the restriction for that user. 
This results in 1. no email being sent to the requestor to confirm their request has been granted, and 2. more work for the page owner.

Consider removing the page link on the email AND changing 'Grant Access' to 'Review Access' (as access can be granted or denied after following this link)
fields.summary: Improve request access email notification
